de.uos.dgrlvq
Class DistanceGeneralizedWeightedEuclidean

java.lang.Object
  de.uos.dgrlvq.DistanceGeneralizedWeightedEuclidean
All Implemented Interfaces:
DistanceInterface
public class DistanceGeneralizedWeightedEuclidean
extends java.lang.Object
implements DistanceInterface

This class implements gradient descent method for the calculation of distance matrices environment.

Author:
Gulraj Singh Mrok

Method Detail

normalizeLambdas

public void normalizeLambdas()
Description copied from interface: DistanceInterface
Normalizes Lambda relevance vector. This means the relevance vector lambda L1, L2… Ln must stay as square(L1) + square(L2)+ … + square(Ln)=1 where n=dimension of training vector.

Specified by:
normalizeLambdas in interface DistanceInterface

calculateDistance

public double calculateDistance(double[] a,
                                double[] b)
Calculates distance between two vectors. for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) { diff = a[i]-b[i]; sum += Math.pow(lambdas[i], expo_lmb)*Math.pow(diff, expo_coord) ; } return sum;

Specified by:
calculateDistance in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
a - first vector
b - second vector
Returns:
the distance

derivativeLamdba

public double derivativeLamdba(double[] inputs,
                               double[] weights,
                               int i)
Derivative wrt to lambda. return expo_lmb * Math.pow((inputs[i]-weights[i]), expo_coord) * Math.pow(lambdas[i], expo_lmb-1);

Specified by:
derivativeLamdba in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
inputs - input vector
weights - weight vector
i - index
Returns:
derivative

derivativeWeights

public double derivativeWeights(double[] x,
                                double[] w,
                                int comp_idx)
Derivative wrt weights return -expo_coord * Math.pow((x[comp_idx]-w[comp_idx]), expo_coord-1) * Math.pow(lambdas[comp_idx], expo_lmb);

Specified by:
derivativeWeights in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
x - input
w - weight
comp_idx - index
Returns:
derivative

setLambdas

public void setLambdas(double[] lmd)
Description copied from interface: DistanceInterface
Sets the global lambda relevance vector to distance matrices. The relevance vector lambda L1, L2… Ln is fixed with square(L1) + square(L2)+ … + square(Ln)=1 where n=dimension of training vector. The lambda relevance vector tells the relevance factor of certain dimention. in other words it tells how important certain dimention is.

Specified by:
setLambdas in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
lmd - The lambda relevance vector
